alert.note: Alert for Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:53PM EDT until July 12 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Center Rutland affecting Rutland County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Center Rutland. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Many homes will be affected. Flood levels will be similar to those seen in Irene in August 2011. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Monday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Monday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 08/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM EDT.
